content.title: Great Saphenous Vein Mapping
content.description: Pre-operative duplex ultrasound mapping of the great saphenous vein for conduit harvest in arterial bypass surgery.
key_concepts: Documentation of GSV course from groin to ankle
Identification of major tributaries and accessory veins
Assessment for sclerosis, thrombosis, or previous cannulation
Marking of vein position on skin surface
content.clinical_application: Essential for bypass planning when autogenous conduit is preferred. Single continuous segment preferred over spliced vein. Alternative harvest sites assessed if primary GSV inadequate.

technical_details.patient_position: Supine with reverse Trendelenburg, leg externally rotated
technical_details.documentation: Anatomic diagram with diameter measurements every 10-15cm

content.statement: Great Saphenous Vein Mapping is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Diagnostics Vein-Mapping that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Great Saphenous Vein Mapping helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Great Saphenous Vein Mapping include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Great Saphenous Vein Mapping.
